result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R. Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim to be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol.  Defendant shall obtain counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy R. Phillips

Defendant Timothy R. Phillips in court with attorney Richard M. Lawson.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of guilty to count 1.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.    Court orders sentence withheld probation three years with conditions of court costs; 60 days county jail with huber to begin no later than June 1, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  ; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology  to be approved by agent; defendant has provided letters to the court; no consumption of alcohol and counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read in .  Four days sentence credit.  - rt

To Timothy R. Phillips
arrest

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess any firearms. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy R. Phillips appeared in person, in custody.  Court previously found probable cause for arrest without warrant.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $10,000.00 cash bond with booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol and no possession of firearms.  Court orders $10,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol and no possession of firearms.  The next court date is an initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
